verses.text: 以色列人受米甸人等欺壓以色列人又行了耶和華看為惡的事；耶和華就把他們交在米甸人手裡七年。

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Introduces a direct object before a verb.

verses.text: 米甸人的勢力勝過以色列人；以色列人因米甸人的緣故，就為自己在山上挖穴、挖洞，建營寨。
每逢以色列人撒種以後，米甸人、亞瑪力人和東方人都上來，欺壓他們；

words.note: Refers to specific groups from the East in this biblical context.

verses.text: 對著他們安營，毀壞那地的出產，直到迦薩一帶，他們沒有留下牛、羊和驢，沒有給以色列人留下一點養生之物。

words.definition: did not have, there was not
did not have, there was not

words.note: Refers to things necessary for sustaining life.

verses.text: 因為他們帶著牲畜和帳棚上來，像蝗蟲那麼多；他們來的人和駱駝無數，進入境內，毀壞全地。
以色列人在米甸人面前，落到極卑微的地步，他們就哀求耶和華。

words.note: Lit. 'ground step', referring to a state or condition.
To beg mournfully or desperately.

verses.text: 以色列人因米甸人的緣故，向耶和華呼求的時候，

words.note: To call out begging, to implore.
Forms an adverbial phrase with '時候' (when).

verses.text: 耶和華就差派一位先知到以色列人那裡，對他們說：「耶和華以色列的 神這樣說：『我曾經把你們從埃及領上來，領你們出了為奴之家；

words.note: One who knows/speaks before (God's message).
Often capitalized in translation; in Chinese Bibles, sometimes preceded by an ideographic space for reverence.
Used here to describe the 'house of slavery'.
Classical equivalent of '的'.

verses.text: 我曾經把你們從埃及人的手拯救出來，拯救你們脫離所有欺壓你們的人的手，把他們從你們面前趕走，把他們的地賜給你們。

words.note: Figuratively, power or control.
To make whole by saving.
Figuratively, power or control.

verses.text: 我又對你們說：我是耶和華你們的 神；你們住在亞摩利人的地，不可敬畏他們的神。但你們沒有聽從我的話。』」

words.note: Often used in religious context meaning 'fear of God'.
Lowercase 'shén' here refers to pagan gods.

verses.text: 基甸蒙召耶和華的使者來到，坐在俄弗拉，一棵屬於亞比以謝族人約阿施的橡樹下；約阿施的兒子基甸正在壓酒池裡打麥子，為要躲避米甸人的搶奪。

words.note: Lit. 'to receive a call'; often used for divine calling.
Often refers to an angel in biblical contexts.
A basin or vat for pressing grapes to extract juice for wine.

verses.text: 耶和華的使者向基甸顯現，對他說：「大能的勇士啊，耶和華與你同在。」

words.note: Often used for divine or miraculous appearances.
Often used in biblical contexts to describe God's power or mighty men.
A common phrase in the Bible, signifying God's presence.

verses.text: 基甸回答他，說：「唉，我的主，如果耶和華與我們同在，我們怎會遭遇這一切事呢？我們的列祖向我們講述的，耶和華的一切奇事在哪裡呢？他們曾說：『耶和華不是把我們從埃及領上來嗎？』現在他卻拋棄了我們，把我們交在米甸人手中！」

words.note: Refers to God or a venerable figure in religious texts.
Commonly refers to patriarchs in biblical texts.
Used to form a rhetorical question expecting an affirmative answer.

verses.text: 耶和華轉向基甸，對他說：「你靠著你這能力，去拯救以色列人脫離米甸人的手吧；我不是差派了你嗎？」

words.note: While common, has strong biblical connotations in contexts of salvation.
Often refers to being sent by divine authority or for a special mission.

verses.text: 基甸對他說：「唉，我主啊，我憑著甚麼拯救以色列人呢？看哪，我的家族在瑪拿西支派中是最卑微的，我在我的父家是最年輕的。」

words.note: An archaic interjection, common in biblical translations.

verses.text: 耶和華對他說：「因為我必與你同在，你就必擊打米甸人，像擊打一人一樣。」

words.note: Commonly used in Christian contexts for God being with people.

verses.text: 基甸又對他說：「如果我在你眼前蒙恩，求你給我一個憑據，證實是你與我說話。

words.note: A common biblical idiom for receiving God's favor.
Often refers to a miraculous sign or token in scripture.

verses.text: 求你不要離開這裡，等我回來，把我的禮物帶來，擺在你面前。」他回答：「我必等你回來。」

words.note: Indicates the object of the verb precedes it.

verses.text: 基甸去預備了一隻山羊羔，和十公斤麵粉做的無酵餅，把肉放在籃子裡，把湯盛在鍋中，帶到橡樹之下，獻上給他。

words.note: Measure word for certain animals (e.g., goat, bird).
Connects a descriptive phrase to a noun.
Bread made without yeast, significant in Passover.
Commonly used for making offerings to God.

verses.text: 神的使者對基甸說：「把肉和無酵餅拿出來，擺在這塊磐石上，把湯倒出來。」他就這樣行了。

words.note: Refers to the singular, transcendent God.
Often refers to divine messengers or angels in the Bible.
Verb with directional complement.
Measure word for pieces, chunks, or flat objects like rocks.
Often used metaphorically for stability or God as a refuge.
Verb with directional complement.

verses.text: 耶和華的使者伸出手中的杖，杖頭一觸著肉和無酵餅，就有火從磐石中上來，把肉和無酵餅都燒盡了；耶和華的使者就從基甸的眼前消失了。

words.note: Lit. 'sending person'
Lit. 'bread without leaven'
Lit. 'bread without leaven'
Lit. 'sending person'

verses.text: 基甸看出他是耶和華的使者，就說：「哀哉，我主耶和華啊，因為我面對面看見了耶和華的使者。」

words.note: Lit. 'sending person'
An exclamation of sorrow or regret.
Lit. 'sending person'

verses.text: 耶和華對他說：「你放心好了，不要怕，你必不會死。」
基甸就在那裡給耶和華築了一座祭壇，稱為耶和華沙龍；直到今日，這壇還在亞比以謝族的俄弗拉。

words.note: Lit. 'sacrifice altar'
Hebrew: The Lord is Peace.
A clan within the tribe of Manasseh.

verses.text: 基甸毀巴力祭壇當夜，耶和華對基甸說：「取你父親的牛和另一頭七歲大的牛來，拆毀你父親的巴力祭壇，砍下壇旁的亞舍拉。

words.note: Lit. 'sacrifice altar'
Lit. 'sacrifice altar'

verses.text: 在這堅固的地方上面，你要整整齊齊為耶和華你的 神築一座祭壇，拿第二頭牛作燔祭，用你砍下來的亞舍拉作柴。」

words.note: Refers to the singular God, Yahweh.
Refers to the pagan goddess Asherah or her cultic pole.

verses.text: 基甸就從他的僕人中選出了十個人，照著耶和華告訴他的行了；但因為害怕他的父家和城裡的人，就不敢在日間行事，只好在晚上作了。

words.definition: had to, had no choice but to

verses.text: 城裡的人清早起來，見巴力的祭壇已被拆毀，壇旁的亞舍拉也被砍下來，並且看見那第二頭牛獻在新築的祭壇上的時候，

words.note: A Canaanite god worshipped in ancient times.
Refers to the pagan goddess Asherah or her cultic pole.

verses.text: 就彼此說：「誰作了這事呢？」他們追查尋訪之後，就說：「是約阿施的兒子基甸作的。」
城裡的人對約阿施說：「把你的兒子領出來，把他處死，因為他拆毀了巴力的祭壇，砍下了壇旁的亞舍拉。」

words.note: A Canaanite god worshipped in ancient times.
Refers to the pagan goddess Asherah or her cultic pole.

verses.text: 約阿施對所有站著攻擊他的人說：「你們要為巴力辯護嗎？或是你們要救他呢？誰為他辯護，到早晨就必死亡。巴力若是神，有人拆毀了他的祭壇，就讓他為自己辯護吧。」
因此，當日基甸被稱為耶路．巴力，意思說：他拆毀了巴力的祭壇，讓巴力與他爭辯吧。
那時，米甸人、亞瑪力人和東方人，都聚集起來，過了河，在耶斯列平原安營。

words.note: Refers to desert tribes from east of Canaan.

verses.text: 耶和華的靈降在基甸身上，他就吹角；亞比以謝族都應召來跟從他。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Refers to the Holy Spirit or spirit of God.

verses.text: 他派使者到瑪拿西全地去，瑪拿西人也都應召來跟從他；他又派使者到亞設、西布倫、拿弗他利去，他們也都上來與他們會合。
基甸向 神求證基甸對 神說：「如果你按著你所說的，要藉著我的手拯救以色列人；

words.note: Capitalized in scripture to show reverence for God.
Capitalized in scripture to show reverence for God.
Forms a nominal phrase with a verb; common in classical/biblical Chinese.

verses.text: 看哪，我要把一團新剪的羊毛放在禾場上；露水若是單單落在羊毛上，而全地都是乾的，我就知道你要照著你所說的，藉著我的手拯救以色列了。」

words.note: Commonly used in Bible translations to express 'Behold!' or 'Look!'
Used to bring the object before the verb, emphasizing the object or its disposal.
A traditional area for threshing grain; often mentioned in agricultural parables.
A more formal equivalent of 如果 (rúguǒ).
Forms a nominal phrase with a verb; common in classical/biblical Chinese.

verses.text: 第二天，基甸清早起來，情形果然是這樣；他把羊毛一擠，就從羊毛中擠出一滿盆的露水來。

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb, emphasizing the object or its disposal.
Used with '就' to indicate an action happening immediately after another.
Used as a directional complement indicating movement towards the speaker/observer.

verses.text: 基甸又對 神說：「求你不要向我發怒，我要再說這一次；求你讓我把羊毛再試一試，但願單單羊毛是乾的，而全地都有露水。」

words.note: Capitalized in scripture to show reverence for God.
Used to bring the object before the verb, emphasizing the object or its disposal.
Reduplication of a verb or V-num-V construction often indicates a brief or casual action.
Expresses a strong desire or hope.

verses.text: 那一夜， 神也這樣行了；單單羊毛是乾的，全地都有露水。

words.note: Often used with '那' to mean 'that one night'.
Capitalized in scripture to show reverence for God.
